algorithm: In the new algorithm, we will calculate the score for each bin by dividing the rest capacity of each bin by the difference between the maximum capacity and the average rest capacity of all the bins, and then multiplying it by the logarithm of the item size divided by the rest capacity of the bin, with a weight determined by the square root of the ratio of the rest capacity to the maximum capacity.
code:
import numpy as np

def score(item: int, bins: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
    # Calculate the average rest capacity of all the bins
    avg_rest_capacity = np.mean(bins)
    
    # Calculate the maximum capacity of the bins
    max_capacity = np.max(bins)
    
    # Calculate the ratio of the rest capacity of each bin to the difference between the maximum capacity and the average rest capacity of all the bins
    ratios = bins / (max_capacity - avg_rest_capacity)
    
    # Calculate the logarithm of the item size divided by the rest capacity of each bin
    logarithms = np.log(item / bins)
    
    # Calculate the weights based on the square root of the ratio of the rest capacity to the maximum capacity
    weights = np.sqrt(bins / max_capacity)
    
    # Calculate the scores for each bin by multiplying the ratios, logarithms, and weights
    scores = ratios * logarithms * weights
    
    return scores
